thread.title: NASCAR drivers reflect on what they were doing during 1997 Daytona 500
thread.title_full: NASCAR drivers reflect on what they were doing during 1997 Daytona 500

title: NASCAR drivers reflect on what they were doing during 1997 Daytona 500
text:
Feb 23, 2017 at 10:13a ET 0Shares 
In 1997, Jeff Gordon and his crew chief Ray Evernham decided to make a home movie of their efforts in the Daytona 500. 
The Rainbow Warriors went on to win the Great American Race and tonight after the Can-Am Duels on FS1 at 7 p.m., the never before scene footage will air for the first time. 
In honor of ‘Refuse to Lose’, FOX Sports asked current Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series drivers what they were doing during the 1997 Daytona 500. 
Check out if your favorite driver was still in diapers or if they were going to college. And be sure to tune into ‘Refuse to Lose’ tonight after the Can-Am Duels on FS1 at 7 p.m.
